intro: Matelea brevicoronata, commonly known as the dwarf crownflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant features showy, funnel-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, often with a distinctive red or orange corona. It thrives in rocky soils and is often found in desert or arid environments. Matelea brevicoronata is adapted to survive in harsh conditions with its deep root system and ability to store water.
